events.message: The claimant reported a car collision that occurred yesterday evening, involving another vehicle at the intersection.
Based on the initial report, the claim was categorised as an Auto Accident due to the nature of the incident described.
An agent was assigned to handle the claim, ensuring the customer receives timely assistance with their vehicle damage.
The claimant received official acknowledgement of their report and was informed about the next steps in the process.
The insurance company requested supporting documents, including photos of the damaged vehicle and the police accident report.
The claimant submitted all requested documents on time, including detailed images and the official police report from the accident.
A thorough investigation into the collision circumstances was initiated to verify the claim’s validity and assess damage.
The investigation concluded with no discrepancies found; vehicle damage and liability were confirmed as per claimant’s statement.
The insurance company proposed a settlement amount to cover the repairs and losses from the car accident.
The claimant expressed satisfaction with the prompt handling and proposed settlement offer for the vehicle repairs.
The claim was officially approved after acceptance of the settlement by the claimant, moving towards payment disbursement.
The agreed payment amount was issued promptly to the customer’s account to begin repairs on their damaged vehicle.
The claim was closed successfully after all payments were made and the customer confirmed their repair process started.
All documentation and claim records were archived for future reference and compliance with company policy.
